text: A psychiatrist is a medical doctor who specializes in psychiatry. They treat people with mental illness. Psychiatrists can prescribe psychiatric medication. ==Education== In the United States, psychiatrists train by going to university first, then medical school for 4 years. After medical school, they must complete a residency. When they graduate, they get to use the initials M.D. or D.O. after their names. Next, these doctors specialize by training for 3 or 4 years in Psychiatry. In other countries psychiatrists train in similar ways but may not have to go to a separate university and medical school. ==Other websites== * American Psychiatric Association * Journal of Clinical Psychiatry * Royal College of Psychiatrists * Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Psychiatrists Category:Psychiatry Category:Healthcare occupations
title: Psychiatrist
